channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC

item.title: Report E-2023090555
item.description:
Report E-2023090555

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: CHINA GROVE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 11, 2023, one (!) one-gallon jug of UN2924 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 3/4-gallon of product to the box, pallet, and floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. The undamaged cargo was staged in a new area for continued processing and shipping. Granular absorbents were deployed to the impacted area and worked in with hand tools. All UN2924-impacted material was collected and containerized into the one (1) 55-gallon drum. The drum was properly labeled and possession of the material was taken by RLC for disposal through their bulk waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023090553
item.description:
Report E-2023090553

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NWN experienced a UN3266 Gengard GN8209 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of material released to a 6’ x 20’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a cubic yard box. All impacted absorbents were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090643
item.description:
Report E-2023090643

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RDX, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, at 1554 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by RDX personnel in Charlotte, North Carolina regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons of Aromatic 150 (Petroleum Distillates, n.o.s. (Combustible Liquid) UN1268, 3, III) due to a gasket failure. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was contained to an 2' x 8' area on the trailer floor, and cleaned up the spill without complication, They were able to transfer the remaining product to an IBC plastic tote to continue to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DM which was then taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023090096
item.description:
Report I-2023090096

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: Durham
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the loading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to load a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a jerrican in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the jerrican putting a 1/5 inch long puncture in the container. Container was then removed and placed in a position where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: dropped pkg, loose fitting and leaking wet pkg is the reason why this pkg failed. DescribePack: dropped package is critical to a container it can allow the liquid to escape from its package. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Dropping a hazmat can caused major an effect to the container in the result the container was damaged causing the top to lose which allowed the liquid to escape from the package.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During unloading of trailer unopened wet package discovered. Ops Mgr brought package to QA. QA open package to inspect and discovered leakage. No liquid leaked out of package. Box absorbed liquid. Package placed in hazmat bag and processed. DescribePack: Loose cap discovered. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in hazmat package for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023081649
item.description:
Report X-2023081649

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found in unload area at the end of sort by QA. Package was bagged into a hazardous materials bag and into a red hazmat tote to prevent more leakage. Liquid only soiled fiberboard box and none spilled on floor. Package kept upright to prevent loose cap from leaking more into packaging DescribePack: Package failure contains a plastic container of liquid cleaner with one loose cap causing liquid contents to spill through outer packaging. no internal packaging present to prevent damage on impact. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damaged Hazmat was put into a hazardous materials bag and into a red tote to prevent further spillage
